page.title: 01Summary of the Area.
page.content:
This is a farming region situated approximately seven miles south of {Warwick}and a similar distance to the east of{Stratford upon Avon. The land is used for cereal growing and as grassland for stock rearing and dairy farming.
Within the survey area are the small villages of{MORETON MORRELL, ASHORNE} and {NEWBOLD PACEY.}Situated in the south west corner is part of the larger village of Wellesbourne which is being covered ,in detail, by the neighbouring survey.
All three of the above villages are in the valley of theThelsford Brook known locally as the Woozeley Brook. Moreton Hall was built on an escarpment overlooking the valley.
